abstract: United States Atty Preet Bharara announces arrest of New York Assembly Speaker Sheldon Silver on broad series of corruption charges; Silver's profitable legal career has long been scrutinized, and five-count criminal complaint contends Silver's law practice was a fictional cover as he stealthily amassed unreported millions in bribes and kickbacks; arrest throws Albany into confusion as new legislative session gets underway.
lead_paragraph: Preet Bharara, the United States attorney for the Southern District of New York, said Mr. Silver had produced “a nice profit on being a public official.”

byline.original: By WILLIAM K. RASHBAUM and THOMAS KAPLAN

snippet: Preet Bharara, the United States attorney for the Southern District of New York, said Mr. Silver had produced “a nice profit on being a public official.”

headline.main: Sheldon Silver, Assembly Speaker, Took Millions in Payoffs, U.S. Says
headline.print_headline: U.S. Says Assembly Speaker Took Millions in Payoffs, Abusing Office
headline.sub: Albany Shaken by Democrat’s Arrest in Corruption Case
